skill.name: writing-plans
skill.description: Use when you have a spec or requirements for a multi-step task, before touching code
skill.summary: Use when you have a spec or requirements for a multi-step task, before touching code
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown instructions. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, no command execution. This is a configuration/prompt template only.

content.value_statement: Breaking complex features into actionable tasks is difficult and error-prone. This skill provides a structured template for writing comprehensive implementation plans with test-driven steps, exact file paths, and verification commands.
actual_capabilities: Generate comprehensive implementation plans with step-by-step tasks
Break features into 2-5 minute bite-sized actions
Create test-first task templates with failing and passing test steps
Document exact file paths and code snippets for each task
Structure plans for subagent-driven or parallel execution
Follow TDD, DRY, YAGNI, and frequent commit principles
limitations: Does not execute the plan - only generates planning documents
Requires prior context about the codebase and problem domain
Assumes brainstorming skill has already created a worktree
Cannot access external APIs or perform research independently

use_cases.title: Feature roadmap planning
use_cases.description: Transform feature specs into detailed implementation guides that junior developers can follow independently

use_cases.title: Task breakdown documentation
use_cases.description: Create standardized implementation plans with clear file references and verification steps

use_cases.title: Structured task execution
use_cases.description: Generate plans that enable systematic subagent-driven development with code review checkpoints

prompt_templates.title: Simple feature plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an implementation plan for adding user authentication. Use the writing-plans skill. Save to docs/plans/auth-system.md

prompt_templates.title: API endpoint plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a plan for creating a new REST API endpoint at /api/users/{id}/preferences. Include model, controller, route, and tests.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plan to refactor the legacy payment module. Break into small tasks following TDD with test-first approach.

prompt_templates.title: Complex feature plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Plan implementation for adding real-time notifications across the platform. Include WebSocket setup, notification service, and frontend components. Use subagent-driven execution.

best_practices: Always include exact file paths for every file touched in the plan
Provide complete code examples, never partial snippets or comments like 'add validation'
Include exact commands with expected output for verification steps
anti_patterns: Vague task descriptions like 'implement feature' without specific actions
Skipping test-first steps or providing incomplete test code
Not specifying exact file paths or using relative paths without context

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude and Claude Code. It is designed for Claude Code's subagent execution workflows.

faq.question: What is the ideal task granularity?
faq.answer: Each task should take 2-5 minutes. Include: write test, run test, write code, run test, commit.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Use @ syntax to reference relevant skills. Assumes brainstorming skill created a worktree first.

faq.question: Is my codebase data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill. It generates markdown plans without executing code or accessing files directly.

faq.question: Why is my plan not saving?
faq.answer: Ensure the docs/plans directory exists. The skill requires a worktree created by the brainstorming skill.

faq.question: How is this different from regular prompting?
faq.answer: This skill enforces a strict template with test-first steps, exact file paths, and verification commands.
